review.description: This was a fantastic find for something clean and simple, but absolutely yummy to devour every last bite.  I did the bento box with a pick of two onigiri (original and beef),  two sides, and miso soup.
review.author: Wally C.

review.description: Great, simple menu, quality ingredients, very fresh/light and I appreciate the vegetarian options & veggie side dishes.  A nice departure from the more common (and often mediocre) sushi and noodle-centric japanese options for lunch or a quick snack.  Definitely going back.  Also, it seems like they may experiment/try out adding japanese baked goods/pastries or other offerings in the future.
review.author: Joe S.

review.description: So happy this place opened up in the neighborhood. Better than my mom makes - eek! I rarely choose brown rice for my onigiri, but I am loving their onigiri (all brown rice, no white option). Everything I've tried has been excellent...tofu steak, miso soup, hijiki, green bean goma-ae (perfectly cooked), wakame cucumber salad. And my two small kids have been gobbling it up as well. A great place for a healthy, delicious meal or snack.
review.author: Alissa C.

review.description: I only tried the rice balls with spicy tuna. It was yummy definitely want to stop by and try the bento box some time
review.author: Jessica L.

review.description: This is such a nice addition to the neighborhood. Tofu or chicken bento box, rice balls and osozai in a beautifully designed, skylight-lit storefront.
review.author: Andrei S.

review.description: Clean, bright space with thoughtfully prepared little Japanese snacks. Delicious matcha lattes.
review.author: Feather A.

review.description: Serene space, super polite staff, beautiful counter, and completely delicious food.  I had the bento box with tofu steak, 2 vegetable sides, and 2 rice balls.  Everything was delicious, and the rice balls are made to order - so the toasted nori that wraps the rice ball is still crispy when you eat it.  Lovely.  Everything - the vegetables, the tofu, the rice - was fresh and just right.  I particularly recommend the Original rice ball, very flavorful.  But everything was very good.
review.author: Christian H.

review.description: It's a nice place and food is good. The only thing for me is that they don't have an option for white rice. I love onigiri and I consider onigiri as something that shows the quality of rice. I understand many people think brown rice is healthier than white rice but brown rice is reported to have more arsenic (http://www.consumerreports.org/cro/magazine/2015/01/how-much-arsenic-is-in-your-rice/index.htm), so some actually think white rice is better from this perspective. Anyway, healthy or not healthy, I think their onigiri would taste a lot better if they used good white rice.
review.author: Cat T.

review.description: This place is such a great addition to the neighborhood. The food is yummy, fresh and offered at a good price. I also love the simplicity of  as well. I think this will be my go-to lunch spot.
review.author: Ral S.

review.description: The food was good. It didn't blow me away but I really liked the originality. I'll be coming back to try other things and update my review. I highly recommend giving this place a try!
review.author: Isabelle A.

review.description: Went by today for the first time for lunch. Had a bento box lunch with chicken, two lovely side salads, and two brown rice balls (tuna and beef). Perfect little lunch. Took the food to go because there are only 4 stools inside and they were taken. Cash only for now.
review.author: Josh S.

review.description: I don't write many reviews, but I am making a point to write one because I want this place to make it.  I happened to notice it walking by.  It's small and easy to miss.  Definitely a take out place, but the storefront is nice and clean looking.  Their menu is pretty small, comprised mostly of $10-$14 bento boxes, $3-$5 rice balls, and miso.  I got a chicken bento box; it came with 2 rice balls and 2 vegetables.  Everything was terrific.  I highly recommend it!
review.author: Nicholas M.
